Articles.Content: Does anyone here know the maximum angle at which a Klaw could grab. So in other terms, how many degrees of gimbal does the Klaw have.

Hmm. If nobody knows, perhaps you can set up and try your own experiment?

Maybe hold one with a launch stability enhancer (launch clamp). Then drop a plate (with a torque module) onto it from above. Then you can twist it back and forth with the torque and eyeball the angles.
On a related note, does anyone know the impact velocity range at which the claw will grab? I've made it work at around 1.2m/s, so that is definitely within the range

the config has settings of

captureRange = 0.05

captureMinFwdDot = 0.866

captureMaxRvel = 1

maximum range is 0.05m

MinFwdDot is most likely the dot product of the two vectors: your klawn node and the surface normal. fairly safe to assume that 1 means perpendicular. 0.866 works out to be 30 degrees.

MaxRvel, max relative velocity. self explanatory.
